name: Hill Track Homesteads
description: An older, more established section of Hill Track, with rudimentary plots of crops stubbornly resisting the encroaching desert. Hill Track continues its arduous journey to the north and south, a rutted path winding through simple homesteads and a few cabins that have seen better seasons. To the west, a weathered structure hints at a place of learning or records. The air is still, broken only by the distant bray of a donkey and the occasional chirp of a desert bird, oblivious to the subtle grit of the west.
